# decodeRestorableState(with:)

**Instance Method**

Decodes and restores state-related information for the object.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func decodeRestorableState(with coder: NSCoder)
```

## Parameters

- **coder**: The coder object to use to decode the state of the view.

## Discussion

If your app supports state restoration, you can implement this method on any object for which you also overrode the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIStateRestoring/encodeRestorableState(with:)] method. Your implementation of this method should read any saved state information from the archive and use it to restore the object to its previous configuration. If your [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIStateRestoring/encodeRestorableState(with:)] method called `super`, this method should similarly call `super` at some point in its implementation.

## Encoding and decoding the object

- **encodeRestorableState(with:)**: Encodes state-related information for the object.
- **applicationFinishedRestoringState()**: Called after all objects have had a chance to decode their state.
